verses.verse: And it came to pass at that time<WH6256>, that Judah<WH3063> went down<WH3381> from his brethren<WH251>, and turned<WH5186> in to a certain<WH376> Adullamite<WH5726>, whose name<WH8034> was Hirah<WH2437>.
And Judah<WH3063> saw<WH7200> there a daughter<WH1323> of a certain<WH376> Canaanite<WH3669>, whose name<WH8034> was Shuah<WH7770>; and he took her<WH3947>, and went in<WH935> unto her.
And she conceived<WH2029>, and bare<WH3205> a son<WH1121>; and he called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Er<WH6147>.
And she conceived<WH2029> again, and bare<WH3205> a son<WH1121>; and she called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Onan<WH209>.
And she yet again conceived<WH3254>, and bare<WH3205> a son<WH1121>; and called<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Shelah<WH7956>: and he was at Chezib<WH3580>, when she bare<WH3205> him.
And Judah<WH3063> took<WH3947> a wife<WH802> for Er<WH6147> his firstborn<WH1060>, whose name<WH8034> was Tamar<WH8559>.
And Er<WH6147>, Judah's<WH3063> firstborn<WH1060>, was wicked<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the LORD<WH3068>; and the LORD<WH3068> slew<WH4191> him.
And Judah<WH3063> said<WH559> unto Onan<WH209>, Go in<WH935> unto thy brother's<WH251> wife<WH802>, and marry<WH2992> her, and raise up<WH6965> seed<WH2233> to thy brother<WH251>.

And Onan<WH209> knew<WH3045> that the seed<WH2233> should not be his; and it came to pass, when<WH518> he went in<WH935> unto his brother's<WH251> wife<WH802>, that he spilled<WH7843> it on the ground<WH776>, lest<WH1115> that he should give<WH5414> seed<WH2233> to his brother<WH251>.
And the thing which<WH834> he did<WH6213> displeased<WH3415> <WH5869> the LORD<WH3068>: wherefore he slew<WH4191> him also. displeased: Heb. was evil in the eyes of the Lord

Then said<WH559> Judah<WH3063> to Tamar<WH8559> his daughter in law<WH3618>, Remain<WH3427> a widow<WH490> at thy father's<WH1> house<WH1004>, till Shelah<WH7956> my son<WH1121> be grown<WH1431>: for he said<WH559>, Lest peradventure he die<WH4191> also, as his brethren<WH251> did. And Tamar<WH8559> went<WH3212> and dwelt<WH3427> in her father's<WH1> house<WH1004>.

And in process<WH7235> of time<WH3117> the daughter<WH1323> of Shuah<WH7770> Judah's<WH3063> wife<WH802> died<WH4191>; and Judah<WH3063> was comforted<WH5162>, and went up<WH5927> unto his sheepshearers<WH1494> <WH6629> to Timnath<WH8553>, he and his friend<WH7453> Hirah<WH2437> the Adullamite<WH5726>. in process: Heb. the days were multiplied
And it was told<WH5046> Tamar<WH8559>, saying<WH559>, Behold thy father in law<WH2524> goeth up<WH5927> to Timnath<WH8553> to shear<WH1494> his sheep<WH6629>.

And she put<WH5493> her widow's<WH491> garments<WH899> off<WH5493> from her, and covered her<WH3680> with a vail<WH6809>, and wrapped herself<WH5968>, and sat in<WH3427> an open<WH5869> place<WH6607>, which is by the way<WH1870> to Timnath<WH8553>; for she saw<WH7200> that Shelah<WH7956> was grown<WH1431>, and she was not given<WH5414> unto him to wife<WH802>. an open: Heb. the door of eyes, or, of Enajim
When Judah<WH3063> saw her<WH7200>, he thought<WH2803> her to be an harlot<WH2181>; because she had covered<WH3680> her face<WH6440>.

And he turned<WH5186> unto her by the way<WH1870>, and said<WH559>, Go to<WH3051>, I pray thee, let me come in<WH935> unto thee; (for he knew<WH3045> not that she was his daughter in law<WH3618>.) And she said<WH559>, What wilt thou give<WH5414> me, that thou mayest come in<WH935> unto me?

And he said<WH559>, I will send<WH7971> thee a kid<WH5795> <WH1423> from the flock<WH6629>. And she said<WH559>, Wilt thou give<WH5414> me a pledge<WH6162>, till thou send<WH7971> it? a kid: Heb. a kid of the goats

And he said<WH559>, What<WH834> pledge<WH6162> shall I give<WH5414> thee? And she said<WH559>, Thy signet<WH2368>, and thy bracelets<WH6616>, and thy staff<WH4294> that is in thine hand<WH3027>. And he gave<WH5414> it her, and came in<WH935> unto her, and she conceived<WH2029> by him.
And she arose<WH6965>, and went away<WH3212>, and laid by<WH5493> her vail<WH6809> from her, and put on<WH3847> the garments<WH899> of her widowhood<WH491>.

And Judah<WH3063> sent<WH7971> the kid<WH1423> <WH5795> by the hand<WH3027> of his friend<WH7453> the Adullamite<WH5726>, to receive<WH3947> his pledge<WH6162> from the woman's<WH802> hand<WH3027>: but he found her<WH4672> not.

Then he asked<WH7592> the men<WH582> of that place<WH4725>, saying<WH559>, Where is the harlot<WH6948>, that was openly<WH5869> by the way side<WH1870>? And they said<WH559>, There was no harlot<WH6948> in this<WH2088> place. openly: or, in Enajim
And he returned<WH7725> to Judah<WH3063>, and said<WH559>, I cannot<WH3808> find<WH4672> her; and also the men<WH582> of the place<WH4725> said<WH559>, that there was no harlot<WH6948> in this place.

And Judah<WH3063> said<WH559>, Let her take<WH3947> it to her, lest we be shamed<WH937>: behold, I sent<WH7971> this kid<WH1423>, and thou hast not found<WH4672> her. be shamed: Heb. become a contempt

And it came to pass about three<WH7969> months<WH2320> after, that it was told<WH5046> Judah<WH3063>, saying<WH559>, Tamar<WH8559> thy daughter in law<WH3618> hath played the harlot<WH2181>; and also, behold, she is with child<WH2030> by whoredom<WH2183>. And Judah<WH3063> said<WH559>, Bring her forth<WH3318>, and let her be burnt<WH8313>.

When she was brought forth<WH3318>, she sent<WH7971> to her father in law<WH2524>, saying<WH559>, By the man<WH376>, whose these are, am I with child<WH2030>: and she said<WH559>, Discern<WH5234>, I pray thee, whose are these, the signet<WH2858>, and bracelets<WH6616>, and staff<WH4294>.

And Judah<WH3063> acknowledged<WH5234> them, and said<WH559>, She hath been more righteous<WH6663> than I; because that I gave<WH5414> her not to Shelah<WH7956> my son<WH1121>. And he knew her<WH3045> again<WH3254> no more.
And it came to pass in the time<WH6256> of her travail<WH3205>, that, behold, twins<WH8380> were in her womb<WH990>.

And it came to pass, when she travailed<WH3205>, that the one put out<WH5414> his hand<WH3027>: and the midwife<WH3205> took<WH3947> and bound<WH7194> upon his hand<WH3027> a scarlet thread<WH8144>, saying<WH559>, This came out<WH3318> first<WH7223>.

And it came to pass, as he drew back<WH7725> his hand<WH3027>, that, behold, his brother<WH251> came out<WH3318>: and she said<WH559>, How hast thou broken forth<WH6555>? this breach<WH6556> be upon thee: therefore his name<WH8034> was called<WH7121> Pharez<WH6557>. How hast: or, Wherefore hast thou made this breach against thee? Pharez: that is A breach
And afterward<WH310> came out<WH3318> his brother<WH251>, that had the scarlet thread<WH8144> upon his hand<WH3027>: and his name<WH8034> was called<WH7121> Zarah<WH2226>.
